summary: This is an email chain from November 2021 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel and contractors regarding the preparation of discovery materials for production to the defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The discussion centers on categorizing files (as Rule 16 or 3500 material), confirming what has been previously produced, and arranging for the transfer of a large volume of data, including deposition video clips, via hard drive.

events.title: Discovery Production Preparation for Maxwell Case
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel and contractors correspond to finalize a large discovery production (approx. 13GB) for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, involving the categorization of files and arrangement for hard drive transfer.

keyFacts: The document is internal prosecution correspondence regarding discovery in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case.
A pending discovery production was approximately 13GB in size and included deposition video clips that had not been previously produced, though their transcripts had been.
Prosecution planned to request a hard drive of at least 32GB from defense counsel to transfer the materials.
The team was cross-referencing materials from a recent evidence inspection to ensure all items had been produced in discovery.
Files were being categorized as either Rule 16 or 3500 material, with some confusion over the status of certain documents like subpoena returns.
